messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Full-assed unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/9/2005 9:23:43 AM Mountain Standard Time, julie@bravewriter.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/9/2005 9:23:43 AM Mountain Standard Time,
julie@... writes:

<< It's not something just anyone can do. And
half-assed isn't good enough. >>

Sandra, can you give a quick list of what you consider "full-assed"
unschooling?


-------------------

No, I can't. It's everything that anyone would come to attempt to do to
make unschooling work from the time they hear of it to the time their kids leave
home. You summarize it. <g>

My best summary is here:
_http://sandradodd.com/unschooling_ (http://sandradodd.com/unschooling)

but you need to read ALL the links.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Full-assed unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra, can you give a quick list of what you consider full-assed unschooling?
messages.messageBody:
<< It's not something just anyone can do. And
half-assed isn't good enough. >>

Sandra, can you give a quick list of what you consider "full-assed" unschooling?

Every now and again, it helps to read the principles spelled out in a reduced form, if you
don't mind. <g>

Julie B
